content.description: Start with a left hand mono pocket, and a right hand sloper.  From there, work up to the crimp rail, veer slightly right of the arete, then continue using the bumps on the slab to reach a solid topout.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter, be sure your spot is paying attention as East Creek runs maybe 5 feet beyond the landing area.
content.location: This is on the West face of the Gatekeeper Boulder.

content.description:
Math Me Up is a good sloper arete problem that starts off easy and gets harder the higher it climbs.  The start is the same as Soggy Dog, but it stays true to the arete through its entirety.

Stand start with a left hand mono pocket, and a right hand on a sloper.  From there, match hands on the crimp rail, then continue up the arete using some difficult slopers (crux) and thin feet to the eventual top out through the tree branches.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is great though.
content.location: It is located on the blunt, west-facing arete of the Gatekeeper Boulder.
